Package operator

Class DataOperator

java.lang.Object
operator.DataOperator
public class DataOperator extends Object
This class is responsible for interacting with the database (text files). This class manages the storing and retrieval of data from the various text files.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataOperator

      public DataOperator()

  • Method Details

    • saveMovieToDataBase

      public static void saveMovieToDataBase(Movies movie)
      This method saves a new movie into the existing database (Movies.txt). If the text file is not found, it will create a new text file containing this movie
      Parameters:
      movie - The movie object to be saved to database

    • overwriteMoviesDatabaseWithMovies

      public static void overwriteMoviesDatabaseWithMovies(ArrayList<Movies> movies)
      This method overwrites the existing movie database (Movies.txt) with the new ArrayList of movies in the parameter
      Parameters:
      movies - The movies to be used to overwrite and replace the existing movies in the movies database

    • retrieveAllMovies

      public static ArrayList<Movies> retrieveAllMovies()
      This method retrieves all the movies stored in the database (Movies.txt). It will return an empty ArrayList of movies if the database (Movies.txt) is not found
      Returns:

    • deleteMovieByName

      public static void deleteMovieByName(String movieName)
      This method helps to delete an existing movie with the same name as the parameter. If no movies are found with that name, no movies will be deleted
      Parameters:
      movieName - The name of the movie

    • modifyMovieWithNewValues

      public static void modifyMovieWithNewValues(Movies movie)
      When we want to modify the details of an existing movie in the database (Movies.txt), we can pass the modified movie object as parameter and the existing movie in the database will be updated. Note that if no existing movies in the database that has the same name as the title name of the movie object in the parameter, the movie object will be inserted into the database as a new movie
      Parameters:
      movie - The movie object with updated value

    • saveNewAdminUser

      public static void saveNewAdminUser(Staff adminUser)
      This method helps to add new admin user into the admin users database (AdminUsers.txt). Note that if the database already contains another admin user with the same name (case insensitive), this admin user will not be saved.
      Parameters:
      adminUser - The new admin user to be inserted into the database

    • retrieveAllAdminUsers

      public static ArrayList<Staff> retrieveAllAdminUsers()
      This method returns the ArrayList of all existing admin users in the database (AdminUsers.txt)
      Returns:
      List of existing admin users in the database

    • overwriteCineplexDatabaseWithNewCineplexes

      public static void overwriteCineplexDatabaseWithNewCineplexes(ArrayList<Cineplex> cineplexes)
      This method overwrites the database (Cineplexes.txt) with new cineplexes in the parameter
      Parameters:
      cineplexes - The cineplexes to be used to overwrite the database

    • retrieveAllCineplexes

      public static ArrayList<Cineplex> retrieveAllCineplexes()
      This method returns the list of cineplexes in the database (Cineplexes.txt)
      Returns:
      An array of the cineplexes

    • updateCineplexValues

      public static void updateCineplexValues(Cineplex cineplex)
      This method helps to update existing cineplex in the database with new state or values. This method works by searching the database and finding a cineplex with matching name, and replacing that cineplex with the new cineplex object in the parameter
      Parameters:
      cineplex - The cineplex with updated values

    • overwriteOrdersDatabaseWithNewOrders

      public static void overwriteOrdersDatabaseWithNewOrders(ArrayList<Transaction> orders)
      This method overwrites the existing orders database (Orders.txt) with the new orders array in the parameter
      Parameters:
      orders - The list of orders to be used for overwriting the database

    • retrieveAllOrders

      public static ArrayList<Transaction> retrieveAllOrders()
      This method returns the existing orders in the database (Orders.txt)
      Returns:
      Existing orders in the database

    • saveNewOrder

      public static void saveNewOrder(Transaction order)
      This method helps to save new order object into the existing database (Orders.txt)
      Parameters:
      order - Order object to be inserted into the database

    • savePriceConfiguration

      public static void savePriceConfiguration(PriceCalculator priceConfiguration)
      This method save the single instance of PriceConfiguration object into the database (PriceConfiguration.txt)
      Parameters:
      priceConfiguration - The PriceConfiguration object to be stored

    • retrievePriceConfiguration

      public static PriceCalculator retrievePriceConfiguration()
      This method helps to retrieve PriceConfiguration object from the database (PriceConfiguration.txt)
      Returns:
      The PriceConfiguration object from the database
